medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent oral ulcers and cutaneous bullae.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 2 with white lesions in the mouth followed by vesicles and bullae on feet, knees, and hands. Lesions lasted 4 days to 2 weeks and recurred every 3 to 4 months without seasonal variation or precipitant trauma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Seizure of unknown origin at age 3 years; allergic to cephalexin, dust, and pollen.
medical_history.family_history: Several relatives had atopy, hives, and eczema; no family history of autoimmune disease or blistering disorders.
medical_history.social_history: Born at 38 weeks by emergency C-section, complicated by maternal hypertension. Diet low in red meat, not a pure vegetarian, no dietary supplements.
